title: Here's a list of recession signals that are flashing red
text: Here's a list of recession signals that are worrying investors the U.S. might be going into recession.

title: It's up to Trump to break the standstill in US-China trade war, says advisor to Beijing
text: China has taken "all efforts" to address some of the U.S. concerns, says Wang Huiyao, president of Center for China and Globalization.

title: Weakness in oil markets could be 'overdone,' says strategist
text: John Driscoll of JTD Energy Services says there are signs pointing to tighter oil supply in the coming months.

title: Asia stocks dented by trade war, Brexit showdown paralyzes pound
text: Global stocks faced headwinds on Tuesday, stymied by U.S.-China trade frictions while the British pound flirted with 2 1/2-year lows as Prime Minister Boris Johnson indicated he could call an election to block lawmakers' efforts to avert a no-deal Brexit.

title: Oil prices mixed as market eyes trade war, awaits stocks data
text: Oil prices were mixed on Tuesday as the ongoing U.S.-China trade war cast a pall over markets, with soft South Korean data adding to concerns over emerging markets and a rise in OPEC output.

title: If the Market Tanks, Look for Help From These Stocks
text: Gold is the market's favorite hedge now, but gold mining stocks may be even better, including one that rose 300% last year.

title: Stocks slip on tariffs, Argentina hit by capital controls
text: U.S. stock futures dove on Monday after Washington and Beijing placed new taxes on each other's goods, while Argentina imposed capital controls and cast a new spotlight on emerging-market risks.

title: Warren Buffett on Calculating the Intrinsic Value of High-Growth Businesses, the St..
text: Over the years, Warren Buffett (Trades, Portfolio) has written and talked extensively about the ways he goes about assessing the intrinsic value of a business.

title: 10 Important Developments for Investors to Watch in September
text: S&P 500 Index INDEXSP: .INX Price Chart The S&P 500 Index continues to trade range-bound near-term as part of a larger uptrend from last December’s lows.

title: Argentine markets take another hit after currency controls stoke uncertainty
text: Argentina's international bonds fell to record lows on Monday and peso got slapped down again after President Mauricio Macri imposed capital controls on Sunday after announcing the government would "re-profile" its debt by extending maturities.

title: This S&P 500 chart just sent a screaming sell signal—here's how to trade it
text: The "Fast Money" traders share their first moves for the market open.

title: Why Inverted Bond Yields Failed To Stroke Bitcoin's Rally? Is it No Longer A Safe Haven Asset?
text: Inverted bond yields which stroke recession fears did nothing for the Bitcoin price. It seems like the asset has lost its credentials as a safe-haven asset but the reality says something else.

title: China aims to rev up shale gas drive, wean itself off imports amid U.S. trade row
text: China aims to slash its growing dependence on gas imports by boosting domestic projects like shale fields as the security of its energy supply comes under the spotlight amid a festering trade war with the United States.

title: Trade war dents Chinese company profits, portfolio inflows
text: Some Chinese business sectors reported solid first half earnings, though a substantial fall in industrial profits and in tepid overseas investment inflows into China's stock markets show fallout from the protracted trade war with the United States.

title: Global stocks slip as new U.S.-China tariffs sour global outlook
text: Global stocks dipped on Monday after the United States and China imposed new tariffs on each other's goods, reinforcing investors' worries over slowing global growth, with no clear end in sight for the trade war.

title: Why We’re Not Going Into a Recession
text: It is not likely that the U.S. economy is headed for a recession any time soon. In the normal course of the business cycle there are peaks and troughs.

title: Confidence in the Trump whim is unlikely to survive a recession
text: In an economic downturn Americans will reassess their president’s unreal narrative and random management style

title: Stocks slip as new U.S.-China tariffs add to growth risks
text: Global stock prices fell on Monday after the United States and China imposed new tariffs on each other's goods, reinforcing investors' worries over slowing global growth, with no clear end in sight for the trade war.

title: A US-China deal that lacks trust could be 'dangerous,' warns Singapore's trade minister
text: The U.S.-China trade war — which has hit business sentiment and roiled financial markets — is often cited as a major risk to global growth.
